TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DynamicExpression extends System.Linq.Expressions.Expression implements class System.Linq.Expressions.IArgumentProvider, class System.Linq.Expressions.IDynamicExpression

Docs.summary: Represents a dynamic operation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override System.Linq.Expressions.Expression Accept (System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor visitor);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression Accept(class System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor visitor) cil managed

Docs.param: The visitor to visit this node with.
Docs.summary: Dispatches to the specific visit method for this node type. For example, calls the .
Docs.returns: The result of visiting this node.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This default implementation for <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionType.Extension> nodes calls <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>. Override this method to call into a more specific method on a derived visitor class of the <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor> class. However, it should still support unknown visitors by calling <xref:System.Linq.Expressions.ExpressionVisitor.VisitExtension%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: int System.Linq.Expressions.IArgumentProvider.ArgumentCount { get; }
.property instance int32 System.Linq.Expressions.IArgumentProvider.ArgumentCount

Docs.summary: Returns the number of arguments to the expression tree node. You should not use this member. It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.

MemberSignature.Value: System.Linq.Expressions.Expression IArgumentProvider.GetArgument (int index);
.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression System.Linq.Expressions.IArgumentProvider.GetArgument(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the argument.
Docs.summary: Returns the argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds. You should not use this member. It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.

MemberSignature.Value: object IDynamicExpression.CreateCallSite ();
.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance object System.Linq.Expressions.IDynamicExpression.CreateCallSite() cil managed

Docs.summary: Optionally creates the CallSite and returns the CallSite for the DynamicExpressions polymorphic inline cache. You should not use this member. It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.

MemberSignature.Value: System.Linq.Expressions.Expression IDynamicExpression.Rewrite (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[] args);
.method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression System.Linq.Expressions.IDynamicExpression.Rewrite(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression[] args) cil managed

Docs.param: The arguments.
Docs.summary: Rewrite this node replacing the dynamic expressions arguments with the provided values. The number of args needs to match the number of the current expression. You should not use this type. It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations. This helper method allows re-writing of nodes to be independent of the specific implementation class deriving from DynamicExpression that is being used at the call site.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression Update (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Linq.Expressions.Expression> arguments);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Linq.Expressions.DynamicExpression Update(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression> arguments) cil managed

Docs.param: The property of the result.
Docs.summary: Compares the value sent to the parameter, arguments, to the property of the current instance of . If the values of the parameter and the property are equal, the current instance is returned. If they are not equal, a new instance is returned that is identical to the current instance except that the property is set to the value of parameter arguments.
Docs.returns: This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
